column1: An ion is an atom or a molecule in which the total number of electrons is not equal to the total number of protons
column2: giving the atom or molecule a net positive or negative electrical charge. Ions can be created
column3: by either chemical or physical means
column5: if a neutral atom loses one or more electrons
column6: it has a net positive charge and is known as a cation.If an atom gains electrons
column7: it has a net negative charge and is known as an anion.Ions consisting of only a single atom are atomic or monatomic ions; if they consist of two or more atoms
column8: they are molecular or polyatomic ions. Because of their electric charges
column9: cations and anions attract each other and readily form ionic compounds
column10: such as salts.In the case of physical ionization of a medium
column12: what are known as "ion pairs" are created by ion impact
column13: and each pair consists of a free electron and a positive ion.
